X.ii.3.B.1.a
.
Definition:  Adverse Action Proposal Period
The
adverse action proposal period
is the control period between the date the notice of proposed adverse action is mailed to the beneficiary and the date that the final decision notice is sent.  The minimum period for the proposed adverse action is 60 days.
Important
:  Legally, the beneficiary has 60 days to respond.  However, adverse action should not be taken until at least the 65
th
day to allow time for evidence to reach the development or authorization activity.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, Chapter 3, Section B - Adverse Action Proposal Period
